data.title: Sam Kinison Biography (1953-1992)
data.text:
Theatre, Film, and Television Biographies

Gary Kasper to Florence Klotz

Sam Kinison Biography (1953-1992)

Born December 8, 1953, in Peoria, IL; died in a car accident, April 10, 1992,in Needles, CA; buried in Tulsa, OK; son of Samuel (a Pentecostal preacher)and Marie (a Pentecostal preacher) Kinison; married third wife Malika Souiri(a dancer), April 5, 1992.

Nationality

American

Gender

Male

Birth Details

December 8, 1953

Peoria, Illinois, United States

Famous Works

Credits; Television Appearances; Series

Hugh, Charlie Hoover (also known as Brave New World of Charlie Hoover), Fox, 1991.

Credits; Television Appearances; Episodic

"It's a Bundyful Life," Married ... with Children, Fox, 1989.

"For Cryin' Out Loud," Tales from the Crypt, HBO, 1990.

Comics Only, Comedy Central/Ha! TV Comedy Network/CTV: The Comedy Network, 1991.

Also appeared in Saturday Night Live, 1986; and Late Night with David Letterman, 1987.

Credits; Television Appearances; Specials

Rodney Dangerfield Hosts the 9th Annual Young Comedians Special, HBO, 1985.

"Rodney Dangerfield: It's Not Easy Bein' Me," On Location, HBO, 1986.

"Sam Kinison," On Location, HBO, 1987.

Saturday Night Live 15th Anniversary, NBC, 1989.

"Rodney Dangerfield 'Opening Night at Rodney's Place,'" On Location, HBO,1989.

Sam Kinison Family Entertainment Hour, HBO, 1991.

Host, Fox New Year's Eve Live, Fox, 1991.

Credits; Television Appearances; Awards Presentations

MTV's 1988 Video Music Awards, MTV, 1988.

Host, The 2nd International Rock Awards, ABC, 1990.

The 17th Annual American Music Awards, ABC, 1990.

The 32nd Annual Grammy Awards, CBS, 1990.

The 43rd Annual Primetime Emmy Awards Presentation, FOX, 1991.

The Horror Hall of Fame II, syndicated, 1991.

Credits; Film Appearances

Professor Terguson, Back to School, Orion, 1986.

(Also producer with Elliot Abbott and Mark Linett) Louder than Hell, Warner Bros., 1986.

Have You Seen Me Lately?, Warner Bros., 1988.

Leader of the Banned, Warner Bros., 1990.

Also recorded Live from Hell, 1993. Appeared in the videos Breaking the Rules: Sam Kinison Live and Rodney Dangerfield: It's Not Easy Being Me.

Further Reference

Books:

Kinison, Bill, with Steve Delsohn, Brother Sam: The Short Spectacular Life of Sam Kinison, Morrow, 1994.

Periodicals:

Entertainment Weekly, April 24, 1992, p. 54; June 12, 1992, p. 28.

People, November 28, 1988, p. 172; July 9, 1990, p. 76; April 27, 1992,pp. 52-53.

Premiere, February, 1989, p. 82.

Rolling Stone, February 23, 1989, p. 24; May 28, 1992, p. 26.

Time, April 20, 1992, p. 37.
